reviews.text: 0,5l bottle from Brittish Store, Budapest. Clear, light amber color with medium, off-white head. Light aroma, roasted malty with caramel. Some bitter spicy hoppy flavour also appears. Fresh, medium bitter taste. Light to medium body, slick texture, lively carbonation. Caramel finish. Very drinkable, light one. Not very special, but delicious. Good for everyday-drinking.

Very good stuff from Hungary(brewed and fermented with new technologies). The beer has a hazy color like a wild-forest honey and it has a huge and stable head. The aroma is unique because of rye what you can feel in the spicy and distinctly nose. If you drink it at a right temperature, you can taste the complex flavour with the acidity of rye and the little touch of hop. A little bit too mutch carbonation, but not  problem. Acidic and spicey aftertaste.
